intro: Trikeraia hookeri var. hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's trikeraia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
